p: Anti-inflammatory activity is defined as the ability of a drug to reduce inflammation (redness, swelling, and pain) in the body. Anti-inflammatory agents block certain substances in the body that cause inflammation [ 82]. Some anti-inflammatory agents are being studied in the prevention and treatment of cancer. Nair etÂ al., (2014) reported that the methanolic extract of Leea asiatica exhibited potent anti-inflammatory effect [ 37]. In another study, the ethanolic extract of Leea macrophylla leaves showed significant in vitro anti-inflammatory activity by inhibiting the denaturation of egg albumin [ 56]. These data represent the anti-inflammatory potential of Leea species.
